Center for Health Informatics and Bioinformatics | NYU CENTER FOR HEALTH INFORMATICS AND BIOINFORMATICS                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             NYU CENTER FOR HEALTH INFORMATICS AND BIOINFORMATICS                                                                                  Home   About Us   Research   Education   Collaboration & Service                                  Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                                     Center for Health Informatics and Bioinformatics                                          The focus of the center is research and education in bioinformatics and medical informatics. The research areas span analytics for molecular signatures and personalized medicine, computational causal discovery methods, biomedical information retrieval and scientometrics, high-throughput assay informatics (next generation sequencing, proteomics, metabolomics, image analysis), and modeling and simulation of biological systems. Center for Health Informatics and Bioinformatics | NYU CENTER FOR HEALTH INFORMATICS AND BIOINFORMATICS                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             NYU CENTER FOR HEALTH INFORMATICS AND BIOINFORMATICS                                                                                  Home   About Us   Research   Education   Collaboration & Service                                  Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                                     Center for Health Informatics and Bioinformatics                                          The focus of the center is research and education in bioinformatics and medical informatics. The research areas span analytics for molecular signatures and personalized medicine, computational causal discovery methods, biomedical information retrieval and scientometrics, high-throughput assay informatics (next generation sequencing, proteomics, metabolomics, image analysis), and modeling and simulation of biological systems. Biomedical Informatics | The Sackler Institute                                                   Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             The Sackler Institute                                                                                  Home   PhD Program   MD/PhD Program   Summer Undergraduate Research Program (SURP)                                  Home PhD Program Academics PhD Training Programs Biomedical Informatics            Print  Email               - A + A                                         PhD Program      Sackler Institute Administration     open/close   Admissions   Faculty at the Sackler Institute     open/close   Academics  PhD Training Programs  Biomedical Imaging   Biomedical Informatics   Cellular and Molecular Biology   Developmental Genetics   Genome Integrity   Immunology & Inflammation   Microbiology   Molecular Biophysics   Molecular Oncology and Tumor Immunology   Molecular Pharmacology   Neuroscience & Physiology   Pathobiology & Translational Medicine   Stem Cell Biology     Spring 2015   Academic Timeline   Academic Requirements   Rotation Information - PhD Program       open/close   Student Life   Contact the Sackler Institute                                                                                                    Biomedical Informatics                                          See Related:   Biomedical Informatics Website Download:   Course Sheet   Program Overview   BMI offers doctoral level training in Medical Informatics and Bioinformatics. The program's focus is on designing and deploying rigorous and high-impact methodological informatics innovations in translational or clinical medicine. Students are accepted with backgrounds in biological, medical, or quantitative/computational disciplines. Strong applicants will have successfully completed at least one course in design and analysis of algorithms, several courses in college level mathematics and statistics, and will have strong programming skills in one or more general purpose programming languages. Prior experience in research in BMI is strongly encouraged.   The program is housed in the Center for Health Informatics and Bioinformatics (CHIBI). Students have access to its resources which include: 18 informatics faculty, a state of the art high performance computing facility, 6 informatics methods research laboratories, Best Practices Integrative Informatics Core that supports numerous consulting and collaborative science projects in the Medical Center, High-Throughput Assay informatics services that include microarrays, next-generation sequencing and proteomics. Students also have access to educational informatics resources, electronic medical record and other data for the purposes of primary and secondary research.   The program has additional 25 core faculty from the Courant Institute, Stern School of Business, School of Continuing Education, Clinical and Translational Science Institute, School of Nursing, Biomedical Library, Translational Science Program and the Office of Professional Development. An ongoing seminar series and other activities ensure continuous exposure to educational and scientific opportunities in informatics.   Typical Timeline     Required Courses     Foundations of Cell and Molecular Biology I   Biomedical Informatics I: Bioinformatics   Biomedical Informatics II: Medical Informatics   Foundational BMI Methods       Essential Leadership & Management Skills   Grant Writing   Scientific Methods: Survival Techniques   Scientific Integrity and the Responsible Conduct of Research         Recommended Elective Courses   *Course selection depends on the student's background and concentration. Selections are made from mathematics/statistics, biomedicine, and computer science.   Qualifying Exam   Needs to be taken by summer Year 3                                                                                                                                       NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
